name: Alpine Linux
description: Alpine Linux is a security-oriented, lightweight Linux distribution based on musl libc and busybox. Itâ€™s widely used in container environments for its small size and minimal attack surface.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Alpine started in 2005 as a fork of LEAF Project. It was designed to be small and secure, suitable for routers, firewalls, and embedded systems.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Alpine switched to musl and busybox to further reduce size and complexity. It uses OpenRC instead of systemd and apk as its package manager.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Alpine is now widely adopted in Docker containers due to its small footprint (just a few MBs). It is also popular in security-critical environments.

sections.title: Container Dominance
sections.text: Alpine is the default base image in many Docker containers. Its minimal size, speed, and security posture make it ideal for microservices and cloud-native applications.
